Thanks for reaching out, Seeker_D. We’re hiring for impact and reliability first—someone who can take ownership of a meaningful scope, communicate crisply, and deliver predictable progress.

Top priorities for this hire:
1) Ownership & execution: can take a problem from ambiguous to shipped (clear plan, milestones, follow-through).
2) Stakeholder communication: proactive updates, surfacing risks early, aligning tradeoffs.
3) Quality & judgment: strong prioritization, knowing when to go deep vs. move fast.
4) Continuous improvement: leaves the team better (docs, process, tooling, mentorship).

What “strong first 90 days” looks like:
- Days 0–30: onboard to our domain/tools, meet key partners, understand current roadmap and pain points; deliver 1–2 quick wins (small but real improvements).
- Days 31–60: take full ownership of a defined workstream; propose a plan with metrics and milestones; ship at least one customer- or business-visible deliverable.
- Days 61–90: operate independently as the owner for that area; improve the system/process around it; set the next-quarter roadmap with partners.

To tailor this: what kind of work do you do best (e.g., building new features vs. stabilizing/optimizing, more customer-facing vs. deep execution), and what’s one example of a project you owned end-to-end? If this aligns with what you’re looking for, I’d encourage you to apply this round so we can move quickly.
